etymology.description: 教(teach) + 育(nurture/raise) = education; teaching that cultivates.
etymology.interpretation: Combines instruction with nurturing to emphasize both knowledge transmission and personal development. Used for formal schooling as well as broader moral and social cultivation.

examples.chinese: 教育改变命运(教育改變命運)。
家庭和学校共同承担教育责任(家庭和學校共同承擔教育責任)。
examples.pinyin: Jiātíng hé xuéxiào gòngtóng chéngdān jiàoyù zérèn.
examples.english: Families and schools jointly bear educational responsibility.

examples.chinese: 政府增加教育经费以改善教学条件(政府增加教育經費以改善教學條件)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ zēngjiā jiàoyù jīngfèi yǐ gǎishàn jiàoxué tiáojiàn.
examples.english: The government increases education funding to improve teaching conditions.
